keyword: how many calories are in a half of a banana
title: How Many Calories Are in Half a Banana?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a half of a banana, including carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, fat, and easy tweaks for your diet.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Half a Banana?
assumptions: Medium banana (~118 g whole, peeled), ripe, no added toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by banana size, ripeness, variety, and storage; values are averages. Check fresh produce for specifics.

quick_answer.text: Half a medium banana provides ~53 kcal and ~14 g carbs, mostly natural sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories are in a half of a banana?
faqs.a: About 53 kcal for half a medium banana.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in half a banana?
faqs.a: Roughly 13.5 g carbs, including 1.6 g fiber and 7.2 g sugars.

faqs.q: Is half a banana low in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, only 0.2 g total fat, with negligible saturated fat.

faqs.q: How does banana size affect calories?
faqs.a: Smaller bananas have fewer calories (~42 kcal per half); larger ones more (~79 kcal).
Minimal protein (~0.7 g per half); better for potassium and quick energy.
